prerequisite: You must have an active PSTN (landline) phone line from Nepal Telecom.

application_process.step_1: Visit your local Nepal Telecom office (the one managing your landline).
application_process.step_2: Submit the official ADSL subscription form.
application_process.step_4: Mention if your phone line has 'Home Metering (16 KHz)' facility.
application_process.step_5: Nepal Telecom reviews technical feasibility (takes up to 7 days).
application_process.step_6: If feasible, you will be contacted for initial payment.
application_process.step_7: After payment, you receive your username, password, and connection instructions.

important_notes.critical_warning: If your phone line has Home Metering (16 KHz) facility, you must mention this during application. You will need to purchase and install a splitter that supports Home Metering, otherwise this feature will stop working after ADSL is activated.
important_notes.service_activation: NT will provide the broadband service within 7 days of application, based on technical feasibility.

equipment_responsibility.note: Subscriber must arrange the CPE (Customer Premises Equipment - ADSL 2+ modem/router) with splitter from the local market. NT does not provide CPE.
equipment_responsibility.responsibility: Installation, configuration, and maintenance of the CPE is the sole responsibility of the subscriber.

important_notes.billing_options: Customer can subscribe on a Monthly basis or on a Volume (prepaid data pack) basis.
important_notes.service_policy: The services are available on a First Come First Serve basis.

post_subscription_setup.modem_configuration: Subscriber must configure the purchased modem with standard NT settings.
